etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Diatoma (genus name), from Greek diatomos ‘cut in two’, from diatemnein ‘to cut through’

definitions: a single-celled alga which has a cell wall of silica. Many kinds are planktonic, and extensive fossil deposits have been found.

notes.text: Class Bacillariophyceae, division Chromophycota or Heterokontophyta (or phylum Bacillariophyta, kingdom Protista)

shortDefinitions: single-celled alga which has cell wall of silica
